item.title: Astrid add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pema Chodron
item.description: "We think that the point is to pass the test or to overcome the problem, but the truth is that things don't really get solved. They come together and they fall apart." -- Pema Chodron

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pema Chodron
item.description: "To be fully alive, fully human, and completely awake is to be continually thrown out of the nest." -- Pema Chodron

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pema Chodron
item.description: "Only to the extent that we expose ourselves over and over to annihilation can that which is indestructible in us be found." -- Pema Chodron

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pema Chödrön
item.description: "We think that the point is to pass the test or overcome the problem, but the truth is that things don't really get solved. They come together and they fall apart. Then they come together again and fall apart again. It's just like that. The healing comes from letting there be room for all of this to happen: room for grief, for relief, for misery, for joy. (10)" -- Pema Chödrön

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pema Chodron
item.description: "The only reason we don't open our hearts and minds to other people is that they trigger confusion in us that we don't feel brave enough or sane enough to deal with. To the degree that we look clearly and compassionately at ourselves, we feel confident and fearless about looking into someone else's eyes. " -- Pema Chodron

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pema Chodron
item.description: "If we learn to open our hearts, anyone, including the people who drive us crazy, can be our teacher." -- Pema Chodron

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pema Chodron
item.description: "Do I prefer to grow up and relate to life directly, or do I choose to live and die in fear? " -- Pema Chodron

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pema Chodron
item.description: "We don't set out to save the world; we set out to wonder how other people are doing and to reflect on how our actions affect other people's hearts." -- Pema Chodron

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pema Chodron
item.description: "Like all explorers, we are drawn to discover what's out there without knowing yet if we have the courage to face it." -- Pema Chodron

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pema Chödrön
item.description: "You are the sky. Everything else – it’s just the weather." -- Pema Chödrön

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "If men gave birth, they'd be less inconsiderate." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "Nobody deserves your tears, but whoever deserves them will not make you cry." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez (Author)
item.description: "To all, I would say how mistaken they are when they think that they stop falling in love when they grow old, without knowing that they grow old when they stop falling in love." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez (Author)

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "The only regret I will have in dying is if it is not for love." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "I can't think of any film that improved on a good novel, but I can think of many good films that came from very bad novels." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Love is so short, forgetting is so long." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description:
"Sonnet XVII
I do not love you as if you were salt-rose, or topaz, or the arrow of carnations the fire shoots off. I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul.
I love you as the plant that never blooms but carries in itself the light of hidden flowers; thanks to your love a certain solid fragrance, risen from the earth, lives darkly in my body.
I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you straightforwardly, without complexities or pride; so I love you because I know no other way than this:
where I does not exist, nor you, so close that your hand on my chest is my hand, so close that your eyes close as I fall asleep. " -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "But I love your feet only because they walked upon the earth and upon the wind and upon the waters, until they found me." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Astrid add a quote by pablo neruda
item.description: "You are like nobody since I love you." -- pablo neruda

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Let us forget with generosity those who cannot love us" -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Laughter is the language of the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "To feel the love of people whom we love is a fire that feeds our life." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "In this part of the story I am the one who dies, the only one, and I will die of love because I love you, because I love you, Love, in fire and in blood." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "And one by one the nights between our separated cities are joined to the night that unites us." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description:
"I can write the saddest poem of all tonight.
Write, for instance: "The night is full of stars, and the stars, blue, shiver in the distance."
The night wind whirls in the sky and sings.
I can write the saddest poem of all tonight. I loved her, and sometimes she loved me too.
On nights like this, I held her in my arms. I kissed her so many times under the infinite sky.
She loved me, sometimes I loved her. How could I not have loved her large, still eyes?
I can write the saddest poem of all tonight. To think I don't have her. To feel that I've lost her.
To hear the immense night, more immense without her. And the poem falls to the soul as dew to grass.
What does it matter that my love couldn't keep her. The night is full of stars and she is not with me.
That's all. Far away, someone sings. Far away. My soul is lost without her.
As if to bring her near, my eyes search for her. My heart searches for her and she is not with me.
The same night that whitens the same trees. We, we who were, we are the same no longer.
I no longer love her, true, but how much I loved her. My voice searched the wind to touch her ear.
Someone else's. She will be someone else's. As she once belonged to my kisses. Her voice, her light body. Her infinite eyes.
I no longer love her, true, but perhaps I love her. Love is so short and oblivion so long.
Because on nights like this I held her in my arms, my soul is lost without her.
Although this may be the last pain she causes me, and this may be the last poem I write for her." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "In what language does rain fall over tormented cities?" -- Pablo Neruda
